review_blob: Great grapefruit, citrus aromas. Taste is tangerine, lemon rind. Bit biscuity in the after-taste. very bitter finish. Nice IPA.

Pours jet black, light beige head. Liquorice, dark chocolate, stewed strawberries in the nose. Taste is coffee, burnt bread crust and just a bit tart also. Medium body and carbonation which some will appreciate as it lightens a "heavy" beer. Very good all in all.
Good looking beer, rich, smooth palate. Alcohol is completely hidden behind the malty, treacle, toffee flavours. Good bitter-sweet balance. Dangerously drinkable at 9.5 %

Fruity, zesty, floral tastes and aromas in this refreshing, well-carbonated ipa. The bitterness of the hops although quite low-key while drinking is surprisingly lasting on the palate. Stock up for summer I say.
beer_name: De Dochter van de Korenaar Belle-Fleur IPA

review_blob: User-friendly inoffensive stout. Not too heavy, bitter, smokey etc. Doesnt impress but drinkable.

Attractive amber colour, creamy off-white head. Over-ripe fruit, pineapple,musty, earthy, blue cheese aromas. Taste is quite sweet up-front, tangy, grapefruit notes following. Palate is perhaps too rich for me with the initial sweetness. After-taste not too bitter. Very good.

Pours amber, 1cm creamy off-white head, great lacing, good-looking beer. Aroma is tangerine, resin, bit of blue-cheese. Taste is hops, grapefruit, good balance between sweet and bitter. Palate is slick and smooth with bitter floral after-taste. An excellent DIPA. My bottle says 85 IBU and it feels like it. Very good indeed.
Aroma is honey, sherry, balsamic vinegar. Taste is tart, sharp, sweet and syrupy and then bitter. Body is syrupy also. Curious brew.
Pours golden/copper coloured, no head, slight lacing. Aroma is tangerine, grapefruit, mango. Taste is citrus bitterness that lingers. Smooth palate and medium carbonation. Very pleasant.

Unattractive murky dark brown appearance. Ripe fruit and woodsmoke in the nose. Palate is smooth, velvety, light carbo. Lots of tastes jumping out here, with no dominant flavour. Sour fruit, banana, malt and some smokiness. Obviously a hybrid brew that I wouldve rated higher if it wasnt so ugly.
beer_name: Freigeist / Ngne  The Best Brewjob Ever Imperial Alt

review_blob: Good-looking beer, rich amber with even off-white head. Nose is sweet, citrus, malt, perhaps a touch of blue-cheese. Palate is great, quite rich but with medium carbonation. Taste is bitter, grapefruit, not too floral. Bitterness lingers and gets under the tongue like roquefort cheese. This is very good work from a French brewer. Hooray !! At last.
Very nice "stoutish" black ipa. Great palate, rich and velvety. Cant really understand the bad reviews. Lacks a bit of character perhaps and the hops are subtle but solid nonetheless.

Quite sweet, biscuity aroma, malty. Rich palate, good carbonation. Taste is quite malty for an IPA also. Reminds me of a "Fullers 1845" with some extra bitterness thrown in. A "greedy" beer that Id be happy to spend the evening with.

Getting a lot more stout than IPA in the taste. To be honest I get a lot more quad than stout in the aromas (boiled sweets). Cant find a label that fits for this beer but its interesting. Palate is very velvety and laaaaaasting bitterness !

Pours dark brown, flat, no head. Aroma is charred wood, burnt tobacco, ripe fruit. Taste is sweet n sour up front, then smokey. Leaves sugar on the lips and a burnt (not roasted) after-taste. Palate is syrupy. Mixed bag here, Flanders Ale, Rauchbier, Porter all in one. Jack of all trades syndrome but quite pleasant.

Pours copper coloured and flat, no head at all. Strong aromas of honey and...honey ! Palate is extremely rich and syrupy. Very sweet with a touch of bitterness skipping around the edges. Very enjoyable but I wouldnt drink more than one of these. Probably great with a good blue cheese or strong camembert.

Subtlety seems to be the intention here. The smokey, liquorice, chocolate tones are all here, as much in the aroma as the flavour but all very under-stated. I would have preferred a bit more smokiness. The texture is fantastic, thick and creamy with just the right touch of carbo. Overall very easy to drink which is surprising considering the "hype" on the label.

If there was no label on this I would say its a Doppelbock. Sweet and smokey. Looks awful, like a bad home-brew but beauty is only skin deep. A rich, sticky palate, no carb. I was surprised on reading other reviews that no-one picks up the smokey aromas that jump out with the ripe fruit notes. A beer that hesitates between styles but is very pleasant.
Lovely rich, ripe mandarin orange aromas. Little bit of blue cheese in there as well. Thickish palate, and perhaps a bit too sweet although the bitterness is present too. Solid DIPA.

To be honest the stout character comes through much, much more than the IPA.The smokey, coffee, darker aromas and flavours are much more present than the hoppy, fruity traits. Very pleasant nonetheless.
beer_name: De la Senne Brusseleir Zwet IPA

review_blob: Pours jet black with a massive beige head that lasts forever. Took 15 mins to get the beer in the glass. Lovely charcoal, blue cheese, chocolate aromas. Palate is thick but lively. Blue cheese comes through in the taste with burnt coffee, chocolate notes and some over-ripe fruit thrown in. Not subtle but very tasty.
Citrusy, soapy aromas. Heavy lacing. Some good body. Refreshing, bitter taste. Overall quite good

Beautiful rich amber colour, slight head. Aroma is charred wood, over-ripe fruit, banana, charcoal. Great smokey, fruity flavours, like a burnt "dubbel". Palate is rich and smooth. I really wasnt expecting this to be so sweet and greedy. Much, much less in your face than other smoked beers Ive tried. This will become a regular in the "cellar".

Great amber colour, surprisingly clear for a "live" belgian ale. Aroma is bananas and boiled sweets. Boiled sweets in the taste as well. Spicy but without the over the top cloves and cinnamon thang you get with most xmas beers. Good carbonation and light palate make this too drinkable for a 12% beer. Very nice.
Overpowering smell of liquorice here. I usually love this type of Xmas beer with the extra spicy notes but the liquorice theme is too much for me.
Was expecting a bit more "oomph" from this ipa. As other reviewers have said, it probably needs just a few more hops to give it a richer aroma and taste. Very pleasant nonetheless.
beer_name: Lost Coast Indica India Pale Ale

review_blob: Nice aroma of boiled sweets, toffee. Rich, velvety palate and very smooth tasting. Lalcohol is invisible here, which is perhaps my only gripe.

Pours stoutish, coffee coloured head. Aroma is very slightly citrus but more coffee, liquorice, blue cheese. Palate is great, smooth not too heavy. Taste is laid back with the stoutish flavours tempered by some floral ipa notes. I like this a lot, seems well rounded and balanced.

After enjoying their "Blonde Ale" I was looking forward to trying this one. Very much like the blonde ale which is all out bitter hoppiness the "Bruna" is all out maltiness. A bit overpowering for me but some may like it. Ol !.

Slightly murky amber colour with thin white head. Pink grapefruit, lemon and a bit of blue cheese in the nose. Bitter citrus and floral notes in the flavour with a rich palate. Overall quite smooth and tasty.

Strong grapefruit aroma thate bodes well. Powerful hoppy, citrusy flavours and a light palate make this crisp and refreshing. Hats off to these guys for packing so much flavour into a session strength beer ! Had this on tap in the "Rosses I Torrades" shop in Barcelona after a trudge through the Spanish sun and boy did it do me good.
Great colour, amber with fluffy white head. Pink grapefruit and tangerine in the nose. Bitter and punchy on the palate with a nice crispness. Taste has all these elements going on. Very good.
Quite simply, nectar from the gods ! Rich, powerful flavours and aromas. Started with this at the GBBF, mistake. Everything got fuzzy after and the other beers couldnt compete. Best Ipa Ive had.
A smooth stout with trapist leanings. Little bit of smokiness in there, some soft fruity tones as well. Palate is smoooooth but not sickly. At its best at room temperature. Very nice.
beer_name: De Dochter van de Korenaar Charbon

review_blob: Good looking beer, golden with thick frothy head. Malty, sweet aromas and light on the taste buds. Too much carbo for me and lacking in any real character but not unpleasant.
beer_name: De Dochter van de Korenaar Noblesse

review_blob: Light, slightly cloudy amber colour. No head or lacing but generous carbo nonetheless. Malty, caramel notes, slightly bitter. Mediocre at best.

Unlike many reviewers here, no head at all on this bottle. Aroma, and to some extent the colour is tangerine orange more than citrus with unfortunately some roquefort cheese notes that Ive noticed on other ipas (what is that ?) Palate is thin with just enough hoppy bitterness to make this pleasant. Also the label looks like it was done by the guy who did the Mr Benn cartoons which is a bonus.
beer_name: Fleurac Le Cowboy & Indien Pale Ale

review_blob: Like a very good best bitter...........which is great. Lets not put IPA on every label though folks.
Refreshingly hoppy aroma. Taste is like a traditional best bitter, no more, no less. Thin palate, medium carbo. Ok beer.
beer_name: Williams Brothers Cock o the Walk

review_blob: Pours rich dark amber with stiff beige head. Fruity banana, boiled sweets in the aroma. This is reproduced in the taste with some bitterness thrown in. Palate is very, very silky and not too thick with medium carbo. Alcohol is stunningly well hidden. Solid beer.

Pours un unpleasant murky brown. Looks flat. Its not. The carbo is actually quite present although subtle. Aroma is all oranges and grapefruit, the wife says cut grass. Taste is rich, thick and sweet up front with tangy grapefruit the star. Bitterness is there as well and lingers well beyond the sweetness although the sugar rests on the lips. Full-bodied beer packed with punchy flavours. Shame it looks like mud but I can forgive that. Very good.

Pours dark brown with a rich head that dies down to a steady irish coffee foam. Typical fruity banana aroma but with some almost stout-ish notes, burnt toffee, coffee. Aroma is reflected in the taste with the fruitiness up-front giving way to a bitter, puckered finish. Creamy palate and subtle carbonation make this an honest, well made beer.
Not much going on here Im afraid. Im just getting "lager" in the aroma. Taste is smooth, slightly bitter and palate is quite silky. Not unpleasant but "provocateur" is a bit of an exageration.....

Murky amber with persistent thin head. Little lacing. Pine, grapefruit, slightly cheesy aroma (but in a nice way). Thickish palate. Tongue shrinking bitterness (but we like that dont we) with the pine and citrus coming through strongly. Not bad but not the most complex ipa.

Bright, clear amber in colour. Bit of lacing, not much head. Brisk, hoppy aroma. Tangerine, tropical notes. Taste is slightly bitter, with lots of fruitiness. Palate is light to medium. Quite crisp overall and leaves the mouth dry. Lots of interest in here despite the relatively low alcohol content.

Pours clear amber colour with thin off-white head. Strong tangerine and grapefruit in the nose. Palate is thickish, silky with discreet carbo. Taste is massive ! Tangy, sweet, ripe fruit notes mix with the bitter grapefruit kick were all looking for. A beer to serve to all beer sceptics. Remarkable.

Pours murky amber, with thick a head that reduces to a steady off-white film. Sweet smelling with that tripelish thing going on but not too much. Palate is very much like an abbey dubel, thickish and syrupy. Taste is good with both the sweetness and bitterness fighting for attention. All in all a bit of a hybrid but quite successful effort.

I desperately want to like this beer but they really make it tough for you. This is my local "craft" brewer and Ive had this a few times in the hope that itll improve. It doesnt. Have the guys that make this ever tried other beers ? Surely they must realise something is wrong. Ill spare you the details but everything about this is wrong. Smells awful, palate is thin, taste is bland. The stout theme comes through a bit but only if your brave enough to keep on sipping. I aplaud and admire anyone brave enough to try brewing in the south west of France but come on guys, you can do better than this !! Go back to the drawing board and start again.

Pours dark brown, almost no head. Has that trappist banana smell with some rich malt thrown in. Palate is medium with very little carbo. Taste is ok with notes of fruit, toffee. Shame the palate isnt thicker as this beer is fighting to be better than it is. Unfortunately for this beer, Chimay blue is cheap as chips in my part of the world and this brew just cant compare especially as its more expensive.

Pours hazy amber with generous head that lingers. Citrus aromas, grapefruit with some sweet malt coming through. Palate is thicker than the pour suggests. Nice lemon rind bitterness in the taste with a touch of sugar. Surprisingly rich overall considering the lowish alcohol content. You could knock a few of these back (and youd want to) Good work from this brewer.
